intro: Comoliopsis coriacea, commonly known as the rough-hairy comoliopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, which are typically grayish-green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
